metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI
plaintiff_advocates: Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh
defendant_advocates: Mr. Chander Shekhar Patney & Mr. K. D. Sharma
key_issues: Here are the key legal issues extracted from the document:
* Infringement of trademark rights under trademark law
* Scope of trademark protection for medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations
* Appropriate court orders to prevent infringement (e.g. permanent injunction)
* Remedies for trademark infringement (e.g. delivery up, rendition of accounts of profits)
* Civil procedure issues related to court fees and costs.
Also note that the following are not explicitly mentioned as legal issues but can be inferred from the context:
* Deception or confusion in the mind of the public
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP vs Innovapactab Ltd**

**Background:**
The case involves a trademark infringement dispute between two companies, Cedar Properties & Trading LLP (plaintiffs) and Innovapactab Ltd (defendants). The plaintiffs claim that the defendants are using their registered trademark "DROTIN" to sell medicinal preparations under the mark "DROTAWAL", which allegedly infringes on their trademark and leads to confusion among consumers.

**Legal Issues:**

1. **Trademark Infringement**: The core issue revolves around whether the defendants' use of the mark "DROTAWAL" constitutes an infringement of the plaintiffs' registered trademark "DROTIN".
2. **Passing Off**: Whether the defendants' actions lead to confusion among consumers, causing them to believe that their products are connected to or endorsed by the plaintiffs.
3. **Unfair Competition/Dilution**: The likelihood of harm to the plaintiffs due to the defendants' use of a deceptively similar mark.

**Arguments:**

1. **Plaintiffs**: Argued that the defendants' use of "DROTAWAL" is likely to cause confusion and dilute their registered trademark, leading to loss of business and reputation.
2. **Defendants**: Submitted under instructions that they were ready to suffer a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause, allowing them to resolve the matter amicably.

**Court Findings:**

1. **Trademark Infringement**: The court concludes that the defendants have indeed infringed on the plaintiffs' registered trademark by using the mark "DROTAWAL".
2. **Passing Off and Unfair Competition/Dilution**: The court finds that the use of a deceptively similar mark is likely to cause confusion and dilute the plaintiffs' trademark, thereby granting relief under these counts as well.

**Decision:**
The court decrees the suit in favor of the plaintiffs, ordering:

1. **Permanent Injunction**: Permanently restraining the defendants from manufacturing, selling, offering for sale, advertising, or dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trademarks "DROTAWAL" or any other mark identical to or deceptively similar to the plaintiffs' registered trademark.
2. **Delivery Up**: Requiring the destruction/erasure of all infringing packaging, labels, blocks, dyes, articles etc.
3. **Rendition of Accounts and Damages**: Directing the defendants to render accounts of profits earned illegally and grant an amount so found due.
4. **Costs**: Ordering costs in favor of the plaintiffs.

**Additional Relief:**
As the suit has been decreed without trial, the court allows the plaintiffs to be refunded their Court fees if deposited. A decree sheet is to be drawn up by the registry.

Overall, this case reinforces the importance of trademark protection and the need for businesses to ensure that their branding practices do not infringe on others' registered marks or cause confusion among consumers.

Mr. K. D. Sharma, Advs. for D 1 to 3

HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C.HARI SHANKAR 
 
JUDGMENT(O R A L) 
% 
 
 
 
       09.12.2022 
 
1. 
The prayer clause in the present plaint, instituted by the plaintiff 
against the defendants, reads thus: 
 
“37. 
It is, therefore, respectfully prayed that this Hon'ble Court may 
be pleased to grant the following reliefs: 
 
i)  
A decree for permanent injunction restraining the 
Defendants, their servants, agents, assigns in business, its 
dealers, stockists etc. from manufacturing, selling, offering 
for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in 
medicinal and pharmaceutical/medicinal preparations under 
the impugned Trade Marks "DROTAWAL" or any other 
mark that may be identical to and/or deceptively similar to the 
Plaintiffs Trade Mark “DROTIN/DROTIN M” as is likely to 
cause confusion or deception or which is likely to have an 
association 
with 
the 
registered 
mark 
amounting 
to 
infringement of the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark No. 
732349;  
 
ii)  
A decree for permanent injunction restraining the 
Defendants, their servants, agents, assigns in business, its 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT

Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 2 ---
                       Neutral Citation Number : 2022/DHC/005466 
 
CS(COMM) 614/2021                                                                                   Page 2 of 3 
 
dealers, stockists etc. from manufacturing, selling, offering 
for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in 
medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the 
impugned trademarks "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that 
may be identical to and/or deceptively similar with the 
Plaintiff's registered trade mark DROTIN, as may be likely to 
cause confusion or deception in the mind of the public in 
mistaking the Defendant's goods/business as and for those of 
the Plaintiffs amounting to infringement, passing off & unfair 
competition/dilution. 
 
iii)  
A decree for delivery up of all the infringing 
packaging, labels, blocks, dyes, articles etc. to an authorised 
representative of the Plaintiffs for destruction/erasure. 
 
iv)  
An order for rendition of accounts of profits 
illegally earned by the Defendant and a decree for an amount 
so found due; 
 
v)  
A decree of Rs. 2,00,50,000/-. 
 
vi)  
An order for costs in the proceedings; and 
 
vii) 
Any further order as this Hon'ble Court deems fit 
and proper in the facts and circumstances of this case.” 
 
 
2. 
On 1st September 2022, the learned Counsel for the defendants 
submitted under instructions that the defendants were ready to suffer a 
decree in terms of the prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the 
plaint. 
 
3. 
As such, it is not necessary for this Court to enter into the merits of 
the dispute. 
 
4. 
The suit, accordingly, stands decreed in terms of prayer clauses (i)  
and (ii) in para 37 of the plaint reproduced hereinabove. 
 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:13.12.2022
16:46:47
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 3 ---
                       Neutral Citation Number : 2022/DHC/005466 
 
CS(COMM) 614/2021                                                                                   Page 3 of 3 
 
5. 
Let a decree sheet be drawn up by the registry. 
6. 
As the suit has been decreed without trial, the plaintiffs would be 
entitled to be refunded the Court fees, if any, deposited by them. 
 
 
C.HARI SHANKAR, J 
 
DECEMBER 9, 2022/AR

tree_structure.summary:
Here is a summary of the section from the PDF:

**Case Information**

* Case Number: CS(COMM) 614/2021
* Neutral Citation Number: 2022/DHC/005466
* Date: 09.12.2022 ( Judgment)
* Parties:
	+ Plaintiffs: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors.
	+ Defendants: Innova Captab Ltd & Ors.

**Plaintiff's Prayer**

* The plaintiff seeks a permanent injunction against the defendants from manufacturing, selling, offering for sale, advertising, etc. medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned Trade Marks "DROTAWAL" or any mark similar to the plaintiff's registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".

**Relevant Filing**

* I.A. 15757/2021 is also mentioned as part of the case.

**Advocates**

* For plaintiffs: Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh, Advocates
* For defendants: Mr. Chander Shekhar Patney & Mr. K. D. Sharma, Advocates for D 1 to 3

**Judge**

* HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C.HARI SHANKAR presided over the proceedings.

Source:
"Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf" (PDF file)

nodes.summary:
**Case Summary**

The case is **Cedar Properties & Trading LLP vs Innova Captab Ltd & Ors.**, summarized from page 1 of the PDF document 50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf.

* **Neutral Citation Number**: 2022/DHC/005466
* **Court Case No.:** CS(COMM) 614/2021
* **Date:** 09.12.2022

** Parties:**

* **Plaintiffs (Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors.)**, represented by Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh, Advs.
* **Defendants (Innova Captab Ltd & Ors.)**, represented by Mr. Chander Shekhar Patney & Mr. K. D. Sharma, Advs.

**Reliefs prayed for:**

1. Permanent injunction restraining defendants from manufacturing, selling, or dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under impugned Trade Marks "DROTAWAL" or similar marks.
2. Permanent injunction restraining defendants from using a mark that may be identical to or deceptively similar to the plaintiff's registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
Here is a summary of the legal document section:

**Case Details:** IN THE HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI, CS(COMM) 614/2021 & I.A. 15757/2021 (Source: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors. - 50. pdf)

**Parties:**

* Plaintiffs: CEDAR PROPERTIES & TRADING LLP & ORS., represented by Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh
* Defendants: INNOVA CAPTAB LTD & ORS., represented by Mr. Chander Shekhar

**Factual Background:** The plaintiffs sought relief against the defendants for infringement, passing off, unfair competition, and dilution of their registered trade mark "DROTIN" due to the use of similar trademarks such as "DROTAWAL" by the defendants.

**Relief Sought:**

1. Injunction restraining the defendants from manufacturing, selling, etc., medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations using the impugned trademarks.
2. Delivery up of infringing packaging, labels, blocks, dyes, articles, etc., for destruction/erasure.
3. Rendition of accounts of profits earned by the defendants.
4. Payment of ₹2,00,50,000 (Rupees Two Crores and Fifty Thousand).
5. Costs in the proceedings.

**Legal Proceeding:** On 1st September 2022, the defendants submitted that they were willing to accept a decree for prayers (i) and (ii), making it unnecessary for the court to enter into the merits of the dispute. The suit was accordingly decreed in terms of prayer clauses (i) and (ii) on this behalf.

**Significant Dates:**

* 1st September 2022: Defendants submitted that they were ready to accept a decree for prayers (i) and (ii).
* 13th December 2022: Digitally signed by KAMLA RAWAT with

nodes.title: Page 2
nodes.summary:
Here is a summary of page 2 from the PDF (50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors.pdf) in 200 words or less:

**Case Details**

* Court: High Court of Delhi at New Delhi
* Case No.: CS(COMM) 614/2021 & I.A. 15757/2021

**Proceedings**

* On September 1, 2022, the defendants' counsel submitted that they were willing to accept a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) in the plaint.
* The court noted that it was not necessary to delve into the merits of the dispute.

**Decree**

* The suit is decreed in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) as per paragraph 37 of the plaintiff's pleading.
* These prayers relate to:

1. Injunctions against the defendants for infringing the plaintiff's trademark "DROTIN" and dealing with similar marks that may cause confusion.
2. Delivery up of infringing packaging, labels, blocks, dyes, articles, etc.

**Significance**

* The decree includes costs in favor of the plaintiffs. (No specific amount mentioned)

**Source**: 50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors.pdf

tree_structure.title: Decision and Orders
tree_structure.summary:
**Source:** Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors.pdf (50)

**Case Details:**

* **Neutral Citation Number**: 2022/DHC/005466
* **Case Name**: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors vs Innova Captab Ltd & Ors.
* **Court**: High Court of Delhi at New Delhi

**Parties:**

* **Plaintiffs:** Cedar Properties & Trading LLP
* **Defendants:** Innova Captab Ltd and others

**Legal Proceedings:**

* **Suit Number:** CS(COMM) 614/2021 (and IA No. 15757/2021)
* **Date of Judgment:** December 9, 2022
* **Judge's Name:** Justice C.HARI SHANKAR presided over the case.

**Decision and Orders:**

* The court decreed the suit without trial.
* A decree sheet will be drawn up by the registry.
* The plaintiffs are entitled to a refund of their court fees, if deposited.

**Notable Points:**

* No specific amount is mentioned regarding the court fees or any other payment.
* The date mentioned in the document (December 9) appears to be an old date, whereas it was signed and dated on December 13.
